definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
to speak one minute and be quiet the next
pinyin: you3 yi1 ju4 mei2 yi1 ju4

definition: to speak one minute and be quiet the next
pinyin: you3 yi1 ju4 mei2 yi1 ju4

sentences.english: When the article arrived, the editor read the first sentence and then refused to publish it.
sentences.chinese: 稿子寄来后，编辑看第一句话就拒绝予以发表。

sentences.english: One example is "One word weighs nine Dings".
sentences.chinese: 字面意思呢就是说一句话抵得上九只鼎。

sentences.english: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge--to the great amazement of the governor.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣仍不回答，连一句话也不说，以致巡抚甚觉希奇。

sentences.english: Do some critical thinking and write your thesis statement down in one sentence.
sentences.chinese: 做一些批判性的思考，并用一句话陈述出你的论点。

sentences.english: The audience ate up everything he said.
sentences.chinese: 听众们聆耳恭听他所说的每一句话。

sentences.english: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣仍不回答，连一句话也不说，以致巡抚甚觉希奇。

sentences.english: Who is it. Suspect is a practical joke, she gives a reply.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”疑是恶作剧，她淡淡地回了一句。

sentences.english: I don't believe in everything the Bible says.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信《圣经》中的每一句话。

sentences.english: A more serious talk can begin with a quotation or a thoughtful question.
sentences.chinese: 较严肃的主题可由一句引言或引人深思的问题开始。

sentences.english: Or it was just poetic bullshit?
sentences.chinese: 还是说，这只是一句听上去像诗的屁话？

sentences.english: In a word, hard work and practice come.
Once the belief thease disappeared. i, a word denied all the past.
sentences.chinese: 曾经的信仰灰飞烟灭，一句话否定了所有的过往。

sentences.english: I like this quote from Henry Ford, right?
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢亨利，福特的一句话？

sentences.english: She broke in: "You've really been to Russia?"
sentences.chinese: 她插了一句，“你真的去俄罗斯了？”

sentences.english: He was not free enough, was how he preferred to phrase it.
sentences.chinese: 他没有多少空闲时间，是他喜欢说的一句口头禅。

sentences.english: Did you memorize the weekly sentence?
sentences.chinese: 你有把每周一句背下来吗？

definition: sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
